alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rains continue over the region from slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from these thunderstorms during the last hour or so. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next hour from the slow moving thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 245 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Doral, Hialeah Gardens, Miami Springs and Medley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
